31cfc762-60f8-4202-9824-fb16cca53c23:::||@!@||:::2024-02-26T01:13:03:::||@!@||:::{"id":"31cfc762-60f8-4202-9824-fb16cca53c23","title":{"en":"Otto no Inuma ni Wakazuma Netori ~Aitsu no Yome wa Ore no Nama Nakadashi Senyou Niku Onaho~"},"altTitles":[{"ja":"夫の居ぬ間に若妻寝取り ～あいつの嫁は俺の生中出し専用肉オナホ～"},{"ja-ro":"Otto no Inu Ma ni Wakadzuma Netori ~Aitsu no Yome wa Ore no Nama Nakadashi Senyou Niku Onaho~"},{"en":"Stealing a Wife While Her Husband Isn’t around ~His Wife Is My Living Creampie Cocksleeve~"},{"en":"Shizuya's Cheating New Bride: How I Cuckolded My Coworker"}],"availableTranslatedLanguages":["en"],"description":{"en":"I worked with this young up-and-comer named Shizuya. He drank a lot with people at the company as well as others, just a sociable guy.  Well liked.\n\nBut he was all but useless as an employee, and when he got married I started to really envy him. \nIn fact, I started to despise Shizuya.\n\nOne night, he invited me over for drinks at his place. His new bride was home and while I really didn't want to be around the insufferable newlyweds, I went anyway.\n\nWe three drank into the night. All this to be decided at the whim of the Salon head.\nSex at the school is both an overwhelming obsession, as befits an all-male society where there are no other outlets for stress, and a matter of down-and-dirty power politics, not unlike an American jail.\nWhen you throw in the Byzantine institution of the Salon, you have a scenario reminiscent of the surrealistic, closed, hothouse world of British boys' schools. Haunted by past sins, Chunhoo abandons his crime life to search for the young woman and son he abandoned decades ago. His yakuza bosses are unforgiving. They want his honor and title back. Assassins trail him all the way back to Korea and Chunhoo resolves that he’s not going to be anybody’s servant anymore. He’s going to become an Emperor, standing at the apex of his own empire. Meanwhile, his son Sukgi is a rising hotshot in the Baekhwa criminal organization in Korea. He’s got it all; money, women and power. But when the Baekhwas spark a national murder scandal, the mob boss forces Sukgi to publicly assume the guilt for the crime by threatening his mother. To save her life, Sukgi must agree to take the fall, a certain death sentence. Will father and son find each other? What will happen to Sukgi’s mother? Will Shi-Nan-Joo be powerful enough for them to survive the murderous intrigues of the crime world surrounding them? And who is the Emperor that Chunhoo seeks to become? Awawa World is a short comic story that goes with superheroes and samurai in feudal Japan. Unfortunately, Awawa World was never published in full as a tankobon or even integrated into a collection or magazine of the time, but only in editions of 5 (March 1983) and No. 6 (May 1983) BIRD LAND PRESS, a newsletter of the official fan club of Akira Toriyama, Akira Toriyama called Hozonkai (鸟山明 保存 会), where this work was published in two parts. In short, Awawa World was never published commercially.This gag story set in ancient Japan attempts to mix modern situations with the older culture (such as a policeman issuing a ticket to a peasant for keeping his horse in a no-parking zone.) The artwork is pretty traditional, but the character designs are flat, heavy and rather ugly. This was an entry in the \"Monthly Young Jump Award\" contest.Some pages of the original World Awawa were exposed in exposure Ehxibition Akira Toriyama, who toured Japan in 90 years. Nijo, a temple where women are not allowed. bb08696d-1c3e-4d9e-986e-96e6a825a1d0:::||@!@||:::2024-03-11T01:12:24:::||@!@||:::{"id":"bb08696d-1c3e-4d9e-986e-96e6a825a1d0","title":{"en":"Kenkyōden"},"altTitles":[{"ja":"拳侠伝"},{"ja-ro":"Kenkyouden"}],"lastChapter":"10","description":{"en":"During the upheaval of the late Edo period, there was a master of martial arts in Kyoto. His name was Kenryu. Kenryu was a dissolute monk who lived in a ruined temple and loved women, but he was a very cool superhero who was sexy but had a strong sense of justice. He was also called Kuruwa no Aizen Myoo or Genkotsu Hoshi after the name of the ruined temple, and his absolute strength was simply moving. By the way, the first episode was \"Teradaya\". The stories are moving and refreshing up to the final episode, episode 10, but one of the pleasures for readers is that each episode features a \"famous person\" from a turbulent era, that is, a historical figure. In any case, Baron Sensei is truly amazing. The protagonist of the first story, \"Kurikara Monmon\", Togashi Buntaro, is a young man who came to Tokyo from a mountain village in the Tohoku region, relying on his late father's war comrades. Buntaro comes to stay at the home of Yamada Jinjiro, a member of the Yamajin family, a loan shark in Asakusa. The year is 1924, and it is the 17th of the first month, right at the height of the Asakusa Sansha Festival. Buntaro's father was a genuine matagi (hunter), and when he returned to Japan after serving in Manchuria during the Pacific War, he learned Shorinji Kempo from a Chinese monk. It is said that his skills reached the level of a master. He teaches these secret techniques to his only son, Buntaro.
